articles.title: Top 10 search results from Google and Bing differ by up to 75 per cent

articles.title: Astronomers are mapping millions of hidden galaxies
articles.description: Millions of distant galaxies are obscured by the Magellanic Clouds, which orbit the Milky Way. However, using several different telescopes, astronomers can see beyond them to build a 3D map of the hidden galaxies
articles.content:
By Karmela Padavic-Callaghan
The Small Magellanic Cloud
ESA/Hubble and Digitized Sky Survey

articles.title: We don't actually know what 'growing pains' are
articles.description: They are reportedly the most common cause of muscle or bone pain in adolescents. But it's unclear what "growing pains" are – or if they are even related to growth
articles.content:
By Grace Wade
“Growing pains” are reportedly the leading cause of bone or muscle pain in adolescents
EyeEm/Alamy
The term growing pains is often used to refer to sore or aching limbs in children. … [+2753 chars]

articles.title: Fast way of making pufferfish’s neurotoxin may lead to new pain drugs
articles.description: Tetrodotoxin, the poison found in pufferfish, is an essential tool for neuroscience research, and a better technique to synthesise it could boost research into drugs that relieve pain
articles.content:

articles.title: Gene therapy trial shows early success in people with haemophilia B
articles.description: In a small study of 10 people with haemophilia B, nine were still forgoing the disorder's standard treatment about two years after receiving a single gene therapy injection

articles.title: As more bird species go extinct those that are left may be more alike
articles.description: A global analysis predicts that as we lose more bird species to extinction, those that remain will be more similar in terms of size, beak shape and other features
articles.content:

articles.title: Mistakenly calling AIs "sentient" is more dangerous than we think
articles.description: A Google engineer recently claimed an AI was alive and that it had hired a lawyer. If judges were to accept these claims, it could lead to AIs being frozen in their biased states, writes Annalee Newitz
